did.abstract: Materials in this collection include approximately 60,000 negatives of GWU images taken by Marvin Ickow. The material dates from 1975-88. The images include alumni, sports, reunions, seminars, development office activities, construction projects on campus, and faculty members. Prominent people include Edward Teller, Thelma Hunt, Chief Justice Warren Burger, and GW President Lloyd Elliott.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Marvin Ickow papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: In 1988 he donated his GWU negative collection to the University Archives.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: As a George Washington University (GW) junior in 1968, Marvin Ickow worked as a staff photographer for the GW Hatchet and as a senior served as both the production manager of the GW Hatchet and the photography editor of the Cherry Tree. After graduation, Ickow began working as an assistant director of the Alumni Relations Office. In 1976, he left the University to pursue a career as a freelance photographer. From this year until 1988 when he began working as a general manager of Unicorn Graphics, a large commercial typesetting firm, Ickow worked as a freelance photographer for many GWU functions including sporting events (basketball, soccer, etc.) commencements, dinners, receptions, and dedications.
Ickow was born in Chicago. He earned his B.A. in Sociology from GWU in 1969. In 1988 he donated his GWU negative collection to the University Archives. This note was written in 2005.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include approximately 60,000 negatives of GWU images taken by Marvin Ickow. The material dates from 1975-88. The images include alumni, sports, reunions, seminars, development office activities, construction projects on campus, and faculty members. Prominent people include Edward Teller, Thelma Hunt, Chief Justice Warren Burger, and GW President Lloyd Elliott.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series houses approximately 60,000 negatives. These negatives are of George Washington University events such as the 1956 Sun Bowl Team, reunions, biochemistry seminars, Phi Beta Kappa, development office photographs, the academic center, Edward Teller, buildings such as the tearing down of the old gymnasium-the "Tin Tabernacle," Gelman Library, Hillel, the medical school, and the 1974 move of the Lenthal House. The series also has images of individuals including alumni, faculty, and famous others affiliated with the University including Thelma Hunt, Oliver Carr, Lloyd Elliott, Sar Levitan, Harold Bright, Warren Burger, and Charles Smith.
This series is unprocessed, please ask staff for assistance.
